segment.source: Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) offers a customized control panel for Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring client computers, called BitLocker Encryption Options.
segment.target: Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) offers a customized control panel for Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring client computers, called BitLocker Encryption Options.

segment.source: This customized control panel can replace the default Windows BitLocker control panel, which is called BitLocker Drive Encryption.
segment.target: This customized control panel can replace the default Windows BitLocker control panel, which is called BitLocker Drive Encryption.

segment.source: The customized control panel, which is in Control Panel under System and Security, enables users to manage their PIN and passwords and to unlock drives, and hides the interface that enables administrators to decrypt a drive or to suspend or resume BitLocker drive encryption.
segment.target: The customized control panel, which is in Control Panel under System and Security, enables users to manage their PIN and passwords and to unlock drives, and hides the interface that enables administrators to decrypt a drive or to suspend or resume BitLocker drive encryption.

segment.source: To hide default BitLocker drive encryption in Windows Control Panel
segment.target: To hide default BitLocker drive encryption in Windows Control Panel

segment.source: In the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC), the Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM), or the Local Group Policy Editor on the BitLocker Group Policies computer, browse to User configuration.
segment.target: In the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC), the Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM), or the Local Group Policy Editor on the BitLocker Group Policies computer, browse to User configuration.

segment.source: Next, click Policies, select Administrative Templates, and then click Control Panel.
segment.target: Next, click Policies, select Administrative Templates, and then click Control Panel.

segment.source: Double-click Hide specified Control Panel items in the Details pane, and then select Enabled.
segment.target: Double-click Hide specified Control Panel items in the Details pane, and then select Enabled.

segment.source: Click Show, click Add, and then type Microsoft.BitLockerDriveEncryption.
segment.target: Click Show, click Add, and then type Microsoft.BitLockerDriveEncryption.

segment.source: This policy hides the default Windows BitLocker Management tool from the Windows Control Panel and, in Control Panel, lets the user open the updated MBAM BitLocker Encryption Options tool under System and Security.
segment.target: This policy hides the default Windows BitLocker Management tool from the Windows Control Panel and, in Control Panel, lets the user open the updated MBAM BitLocker Encryption Options tool under System and Security.
